options.sentence: Hardly had the meeting begun when the director interrupted.
Hardly the meeting had begun when the director interrupted.
Hardly had begun the meeting when the director interrupted.
Hardly had the meeting began when the director interrupted.
Hardly the meeting began when the director interrupted.

explanation.english: Negative adverbials (hardly, scarcely, rarely) cause subject–auxiliary inversion.
explanation.chinese: 否定副词开头（hardly 等）需倒装（助动词置前）。

options.sentence: The committee, as well as the chairperson, has approved the proposal.
The committee, as well as the chairperson, have approved the proposal.
The committee as well as the chairperson have approved the proposal.
The committee as well as the chairperson has approve the proposal.
The committee as well as the chairperson have approves the proposal.

explanation.english: 'As well as' does not join subjects; the main verb agrees with the primary subject only.
explanation.chinese: 'As well as' 不连接两个主语；动词只与主要主语一致。

options.sentence: The book, the cover of which was torn, was still readable.
The book, the cover of whom was torn, was still readable.
The book, whose cover it was torn, was still readable.
The book, which its cover was torn, was still readable.
The book, of which its cover was torn, was still readable.

explanation.english: In formal non-defining relative clauses, 'the cover of which' is the correct construction.
explanation.chinese: 正式的非限定性定语从句中，用 'the cover of which' 结构。

options.sentence: Had he known about the delay, he would have taken a later train.
Had he knew about the delay, he would have taken a later train.
Had he known about the delay, he would take a later train.
Had he known about the delay, he will have taken a later train.
Had he known about the delay, he would took a later train.

explanation.english: Conditional inversion uses 'had + past participle' with no 'if.'
explanation.chinese: 虚拟条件句的倒装形式用 'had + 过去分词'，不加 if。

options.sentence: It was her confidence that made the presentation so effective.
It was her confidence which made the presentation so effectively.
It were her confidence that made the presentation so effective.
It was her confidence made the presentation so effective.
It was her confidence that make the presentation so effective.

explanation.english: Cleft sentences use 'It is/was + noun phrase + that…' and maintain correct verb forms.
explanation.chinese: 强调结构用 'It is/was + 名词短语 + that…' 并且动词形式要正确。

options.sentence: Few of the students who attended the seminar found it useful.
Few of the students who attends the seminar found it useful.
Few of the students which attended the seminar found it useful.
Few of the students who attended the seminar finds it useful.
Few of the students who attending the seminar found it useful.

explanation.english: The verb in the relative clause must agree with 'students,' and 'who' is required for people.
explanation.chinese: 定语从句动词与先行词 'students' 一致，并且指人时要用 who。

options.sentence: She promised to review the proposal and to provide feedback by Friday.
She promised reviewing the proposal and providing feedback by Friday.
She promised to review the proposal and providing feedback by Friday.
She promised review the proposal and to provide feedback by Friday.
She promised review the proposal and provide feedback by Friday.

explanation.english: Infinitives must be parallel: 'to review' and 'to provide.'
explanation.chinese: 动词不定式要平行：'to review' 和 'to provide'。

options.sentence: Not only did she finish the report, but she also submitted it early.
Not only she finished the report, but she also submitted it early.
Not only did she finish the report, but also submitted it early.
Not only did she finish the report, but she submitted early it.
Not only finished she the report, but she also submitted it early.

explanation.english: 'Not only' requires inversion in the first clause and parallel structure in the second.
explanation.chinese: 'Not only' 开头的句子主句要倒装，并保持平行结构。

options.sentence: He speaks as though he had never lived abroad.
He speaks as though he has never lived abroad.
He speaks as though he never lived abroad.
He speaks as though he would have never lived abroad.
He speaks as though he never has lived abroad.

explanation.english: 'As though/as if' expressing unreal situations use the past or past perfect.
explanation.chinese: 表达与事实相反情况时，'as though/as if' 后用过去式或过去完成时。

options.sentence: No sooner had we sat down than the lights went out.
No sooner we had sat down than the lights went out.
No sooner had we sat down when the lights went out.
No sooner had we sat down then the lights went out.
No sooner had sat down we than the lights went out.

explanation.english: With 'no sooner,' inversion is required and it is followed by 'than,' not 'when/then.'
explanation.chinese: 'No sooner' 结构中需倒装，且后接 than，而不是 when/then。

options.sentence: Seldom do the results contradict our initial hypothesis.
Seldom the results contradict our initial hypothesis.
Seldom do the results contradicts our initial hypothesis.
Seldom does the results contradict our initial hypothesis.
Seldom the results do contradict our initial hypothesis.

explanation.chinese: 像 'seldom' 这样的副词会触发倒装：'Seldom do…'。

options.sentence: The manager recommended that he be appointed to the new position.
The manager recommended that he is appointed to the new position.
The manager recommended that he was appointed to the new position.
The manager recommended that he be appoint to the new position.
The manager recommended that he appointed to the new position.

explanation.english: The mandative subjunctive uses 'be + past participle' with no tense change.
explanation.chinese: 要求类动词后用虚拟语气：'be + 过去分词'。

options.sentence: Neither the staff nor the manager was aware of the issue.
Neither the staff nor the manager were aware of the issue.
Neither the staff nor the manager are aware of the issue.
Neither the staff nor the manager were aware the issue.
Neither the staff nor the manager was aware about the issue.

explanation.english: With 'neither…nor,' the verb agrees with the subject closest to it.
explanation.chinese: 'Neither…nor' 结构中动词与离得最近的主语一致。

options.sentence: What he suggested was that we revise the schedule immediately.
What he suggested is that we revised the schedule immediately.
What he suggested was we revise the schedule immediately.
What he suggested that we revise the schedule immediately.
What he suggested was that we revising the schedule immediately.

explanation.english: Cleft-like 'what'-clauses require a linking verb and parallel structure.
explanation.chinese: 由 what 引导的名词性结构需系动词并保持结构平行。

options.sentence: Only after the investigation was completed did they release the report.
Only after the investigation was completed they released the report.
Only after the investigation completed did they release the report.
Only after the investigation was completed did they released the report.
Only after the investigation was completing did they release the report.

explanation.english: Fronted 'only'-phrases trigger inversion in the main clause.
explanation.chinese: 句首的 only 短语会触发主句倒装。
